title: What is NIT? How does it differ from IIT? - Quora

response.answer_text: NIT: National Institutes of Technology IIT: Indian Institutes of Technology Both the Institutes are well-known for their outstanding standards of studies. There is a number of aspects which may be considered while showing the difference between IIT and NIT: In India, there are 23 IITs & 31 NITs which means NITs are spread in more cities than IITs. Less number of IITs offer fewer opportunities to the aspirants so they might prefer NITs instead.If we talk about Engineering Admissions, then students give IIT JEE Mains & JEE Advanced Exam. The candidates who qualify JEE Mains will be eligible for NITs but not for IITs. To become eligible for taking admission into IITs, they must also qualify JEE Advanced. If seeking the admissions in IITs for Post-Graduation Courses such as M.Sc. then the candidates must go through the IIT JAM Exam. The candidates who don’t get admission in IITs through JAM Counselling must apply for CCMN counselling to reserve their seats in NITs.It is obvious to say that the educational standards of IITs are far better than NITs as they cover a course from scratch to the end.The infrastructures of IITs are wider & equipped with latest technologies. Their outstanding Classrooms & Practical Labs are enough to show how technically advanced all these IITs are!The Competition in IITs for Extra Curriculars is merely comparable to NITs. IITs & NITs both conduct the Hostel Competitions every year under the categories of Sports & Many Other Extra Curriculars!Cultural Fests are also held at large scale in these Institutes.It is quite assumable that for placements, IITs have better opportunities and salary packages in comparison to NITs.That's pretty much of it.
